Text: Would BluRays of the first two happen to be floating around in FTP-land?

Is the original 3D format kept in this Blu Ray version? So if I upscale it on my 3D TV it should be pretty descent 3D quality, taking into account the two bottlenecks:

1. Original formatting
2. Artificially calling out the 3D by using upscale function on my Samsung 3D HD screen

Anyone knows something what is the practice of releasing Blu Rays of movies that original screen in 3D for cinema? Can it be added as a paralell option or does it need its own release??
Please answer when you are being adressed by a noble.

Tondre24: If this were in .iso format and you mounted and watched using DVDPro, possibly. Since this is clearly .x264 (says so in the title) NO.
PS Your tv will "upscale" to anaglyph 3D not stereoscopic (what you see now in theatres).
PPS Sorry you wasted your money on technology that probably won't be around in another 2 years.
Nice rip,... pity it's 4:3 aspect ratio.
homericICON: what are you playing it on? played 16:9 for me.
